title: How to get IDA Pro Free to automatically change segment on retf?
content:
I have been unable to get IDA pro to do a simple disassembly of a flat 16-bit binary (bootloader) file. I'm just getting started, and it seems to be harder than it should be. There's a simple set of instructions, that do 
seg000:7C5D                 push    7C0h
seg000:7C60                 pop     ds
seg000:7C61                 assume ds:nothing
seg000:7C61                 push    ds
seg000:7C62                 push    (offset unk_7C66 - offset loc_7C00)
seg000:7C65                 retf
seg000:7C65 ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
seg000:7C66 unk_7C66        db  88h ; Ãª             ; DATA XREF: seg000:7C62o
Right under 
push 7c0h; pop ds
it says 
assume ds:nothing
. 
retf
actually uses the values in the stack to set the segment and offset. Is there a way to manually enable such analysis? Are there more intelligent disassemblers out there? I'm having trouble following the flow and IDA isn't helping at ALL.

comments.text: Thanks.. I'll try to write the IDC script myself; if that doesn't work out, I'll be back on RE.SE! :)
